metadata.Title: CVE-2021-3620 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in Ansible Engine's ansible-connection module, wheresensitive information such as the Ansible user credentials is disclosed bydefault in the traceback error message. The highest threat from thisvulnerability is to confidentiality.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-3620` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ansible - 2.10.7+merged+base+2.10.8+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

ansible-core - 2.12.0-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ansible package in esm-apps/jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.10.7+merged+base+2.10.8+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1~esm1').
ansible-core package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.12.0-1').
